description: A human child travels in a tiny rocket to a small moon and meets a friendly alien who has lost a special star-shaped button that powers its home light. The child and the alien search together, find the lost star, and turn the light back on. The story teaches that helping a new friend and working together can make scary moments feel bright—even in space.
name: Space Advanture

pages.description: The child rides a little rocket and feels excited (and a bit nervous) in space.
pages.story_text: {name} floated near a big round window and saw Earth shining like a blue ball. {they} held a map and made a tiny plan with a pencil. “I can do this,” {name} whispered. The stars looked like friendly lights guiding the way.

pages.description: A friendly alien is worried because a special star is missing.
pages.story_text: {name} landed on a sandy planet with many planets glowing in the sky. A small green alien waved shyly. “I’m Zupi,” the alien said. “I lost my star light.” {name} nodded, “We can look together. We won’t give up.”

pages.description: They work together and find the lost star.
pages.story_text: They walked into a quiet space cave. {name} lifted a star-shaped light stick, and everything softly glowed. “Look!” Zupi pointed. On the ground was the missing star, shining like a tiny sun. {name} carefully picked it up and held it safe.

pages.description: They put the star into the device and the light comes back.
pages.story_text: {name} carried the glowing star to Zupi’s little device. Zupi held the device steady, and {name} gently placed the star into the middle. Click! The device lit up bright and warm. Zupi smiled and said, “Thank you.” {name} smiled back, “Helping makes space feel like home.”

cover_text.text: We can help new friends. Share and work together.
Kindness makes the dark feel bright.
